review: Is this the death of the smart TV?We bought a smart TV several years ago and it's OK.  It came with MLB.TV preloaded.  I made sure of that before we bought it.  How else will a Tennessean keep up with his Red Sox?  It also had the best known apps on it including Amazon Prime, Netflix, and Hulu Plus.  But that was it.  There was no way to select and add more apps that you wanted.  Pretty dumb for a smart TV, eh?If you are thinking about buying a smart TV, don't.  Instead by the very best dumb TV you can afford...best picture quality and other bells and whistles you may want...but also get the Amazon Fire TV for less than $100.  Then you will have the smartest TV on the block and you'll feel pretty smart too.
